name: Digital thinking tools
description: In today's world, we are often presented with conflicting information from different sources. Being able to critically analyse and assess this information is a key skill. This course introduces you to digital argument mapping to help you analyse information locked up in text. It will show you how to write small computer programs to help you assess information, draw conclusions and make decisions. Some parts of the course will make use of the popular Python programming language - useful not just for numerical calculations, but also, for instance, reasoning about sentences and sets of objects.

alignment.targetDescription: Institute of Coding recognition of knowledge at bronze level

criteria.narrative:
After studying this course, you should be able to:
-	describe how digital thinking tools extend our natural capabilities 
-	use digital thinking tools to find information
-	use digital thinking tools to analyse information
-	use digital thinking tools to reason about information
-	discuss the future of digital thinking tools in relation to artificial intelligence.
Completing a course will require about 24 hours of study time. However, you can study the course at any time and at a pace to suit you.
To get a badge you need to:
-	read each session of the course
-	score 50% or more in the two badge quizzes in Session 4 and Session 8 (please note that if you reattempt the quiz, the questions will differ from those on your previous attempt)
